intro: Anisocalyx, commonly known as the unequal-lobed flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive floral structure, with petals of unequal size and shape. The genus includes several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. Anisocalyx plants typically have hairy stems and leaves with serrated edges. They are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their unique and colorful blooms.
